data.event: The frozen body found earlier this week along the shore of Lake Opechee in Laconia has been identified as that of a Laconia man who went missing nearly three months ago.
The state medical examiner's office conducted an autopsy yesterday, identifying the body as Harman's.

event.title: violence - and it could be months

data.event: The autopsy found nothing suspicious - no wounds or signs of violence - and it could be months before toxicology reports come back, said Laconia police Capt. William Clary.
Harman was last seen on New Year's Eve.

event.title: called the police the next day

data.event: He had a fight with his girlfriend, his mother said when she called the police the next day to report him missing.
Months passed, and no one called to report anything, Clary said.

event.title: Yesterday morning, before the autopsy had been conducted

data.event: Yesterday morning, before the autopsy had been conducted, a woman answered the phone and identified herself as Harman's ex-girlfriend.
